item.title: Microsoft Holds More Layoffs Across Multiple Departments
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/microsoft-holds-more-layoffs-across-multiple-departments/

Microsoft is kicking off the year the same way it did 2024, holding layoffs across the company. According to a new report from Business Insider, Microsoft is letting go people from its sales, security, and gaming teams.

Business Insider sources say that employees started getting notifications of the layoffs on Tuesday. Microsoft told the outlet that the layoffs “are small” while not giving information on the number of cuts.

Insider Gaming has reached out to Microsoft about the exact number of people being let go from the gaming division in this latest round of layoffs. As of publishing, no response has been received.

In January 2024, Microsoft let go 1,900 people from its gaming team after it closed on its purchase of Activision Blizzard. More layoffs were held throughout the year via studio closures and other mass layoffs, including 650 people in September 2024. The company even shut down four studios in May 2024, including Arkane Austin and Tango Gameworks. Tango Gameworks, however, would ultimately be purchased by Krafton and relaunched.

RELATED: Transformers: Reactivate Cancelled, Splash Damage To Lay Off Developers

Last year saw nearly 16,000 people let go from their jobs in the games industry across more than 160 companies. In the first 15 days of 2025, there have been 10 known layoffs and closures with at least 160+ people let go based on known numbers. With estimates, we are looking at well over 200 people thus far.

What do you think 2025 holds for the games industry after the last two years of mass layoffs? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

item.title: Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League’s Final Update is Now Live
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/suicide-squad-kill-the-justice-leagues-final-update-is-now-live/

Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League’s Episode 8 is live, the final act for Season 4 and the final official update for the game. 

Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League’s Season 4 Episode 8 is playable now, and the final update will be playable in both offline and online modes of the game. This will be the last seasonal/episodic content update for the game. However, the online features will continue to stay on, so players can enjoy the existing features, such as co-op, while playing through content from the previous seasons. 

Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League’s final update, Episode 8, has been dubbed ‘Balance’. This episode will let players explore a new medieval Elseworld with familiar sights and new locations. The quest will take you to The Quarry, where you have the final face-off against the tyrant, Brainiac. The Arena will also become available, where players can participate in tournaments or interdimensional warfare. 

Along with Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League’s Episode 8, all other seasonal content has been added to the newly introduced offline mode. Players can try out the main story campaign, seasonal story mission content, and more without an internet connection with this mode. Learn more about this game mode here.

In other news, Rocksteady recently suffered another round of layoffs. Also, Tencent and the Guillemot family are considering a ‘new venture’ with Ubisoft assets. item.title: Nintendo Switch 2 Announcement: Nintendo Direct January 2025 Leaks, Rumored Specs & Possible Launch Games
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/nintendo-switch-2-announcement-2/

A Nintendo Switch 2 announcement feels imminent if rumors and leaks are to be believed. Every passing day feels like an excruciating wait for Nintendo fans, so we’ve collated every possible detail including the latest rumors, leaks, and Switch 2 speculation—including a potential Nintendo Direct in January 2025.

March 3, 2017, was a landmark day in the annals of gaming history. It was the official launch of the Nintendo Switch. A money-making phenomenon that has allegedly sold close to (if not more than) 150 million units. The OG Switch has printed money for Nintendo, and after eight years, it’s about time we got its successor—the long-awaited Switch 2 in 2025.

Rumors and gossip have circulated for months about when its announcement could be. 2025 has picked up where 2024 left off, only, the speculation has intensified one millionfold. The Nintendo Switch 2’s announcement feels closer than ever, and evidence supports this.

Do we Know the Nintendo Switch 2 Announcement Date?

No official date has been officially or unofficially announced yet regarding the Nintendo Switch 2 announcement, but it’s believed it could arrive on Thursday, January 16.

Nintendo hasn’t confirmed the existence of the console, but it has acknowledged the Switch 2 leaks. The company’s response was in retaliation to alleged Nintendo Switch 2 Joy-Cons surfacing.

Nintendo has previously said the Switch 2 will be announced before April 2025. Everything feels like it’s dovetailing nicely, and the rumors are only the beginning.

Nintendo Direct January 2025 Rumors & Leaks

A January 2025 Nintendo Direct could be on the cards with the showcase happening as early as the week of January 13.

As of writing, this means the Switch 2 is being announced this week! This is the biggest take with a pinch of salt imaginable, but the source is a reliable one. YouTuber Nate the Hate says the console is going to be shown off, along with a reveal trailer.

Nate also says the Direct will “focus almost exclusively on the console itself” and is saving software reveals and information for a later date.

Again, January 16 is being outed as the crucial date, but we’ll update you as and when we get new information or leaks.

Nintendo Switch 2 Announcement Leaks

The Nintendo Switch 2’s specs and launch titles are two big mysteries right now. Leaks have revealed possible answers to both of these questions with a possible spec list and Switch 2 games.

Leaked Switch 2 Specs

According to X account @Zuby_Tech, the Switch 2’s CPU, GPU, and Docked and Handheld capabilities have leaked.

Here’s the list of possible Switch 2 specs—with more rumored specs on top of this.

Leaked Switch 2 Games

2025 could be a big year for Nintendo Switch 2 games, and possible launch-day software includes Metroid Prime 4, Metal Gear Solid Delta: Snake Eater, and classic Xbox titles too.

Metroid Prime 4 Beyond seems like a logical choice to help shift units at launch. But leaker Nate the Hate has pointed fingers toward Metal Gear Solid, and Xbox ports as well. It’s claimed Metal Gear Solid Delta releases on Nintendo Switch 2 this year—a launch window remains to be seen—and legendary Xbox exclusives are coming to Switch 2 also.

Are you ready to add the Nintendo Switch 2 to your collection? Is this a necessary upgrade that’s long overdue at this point? Drop a comment below and share your thoughts.

item.title: Helldivers 2 CEO Wants A-Listers to be ‘Violently Killed’ in the Movie
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/helldivers-2-ceo-wants-a-list-to-be-violently-killed-in-the-movie/

Arrowhead Game Studios CEO has recently stated that he would like to see A-list actors “get violently killed” in the upcoming Helldivers movie. 

Spotted on the r/Helldivers subreddit (via The Gamer), the Helldivers 2 community has been discussing the upcoming movie in its official Discord channel, where the CEO, Shams Jorjani, recently shared some interesting thoughts. When asked whether the team knows details about the upcoming film, Jorjani responded that they do have some information, as the production keeps them “in the loop.” 

Jorjani was also asked whether A-list actors like “Chris Pratt” will be featured in the upcoming Helldivers movie. He replied that the whole team is “hoping for as many A-list actors as possible—as long as they all get killed violently immediately.”

The essence of Helldivers 2 comes from giving your life for democracy, and the developers want this same form of hilarious self-sacrifice to be relayed in the movie, too. Players have already started making their predictions in the comment section, hoping to see the likes of Sean Bean, Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Tom Holland and more get killed. Fans also don’t mind joining in as nameless actors if they get the opportunity to be mowed down by friendly fire.

On the topic of the Helldivers movie, the creative director also revealed Arrowhead’s involvement in the upcoming film, explaining that they are unaware of what it takes to make a movie and “don’t, and shouldn’t, have the final say.”

In other news, Helldivers 2 developers have already begun fleshing out the ‘high concept’ for the team’s next game. Also, the title was Insider Gaming Community’s “Best Multiplayer Game” of 2024.
